Gulp down a couple lung fulls and anyone you speak to will be far more apt to give you what you want.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So it only works at settlements. Are there any other restrictions I need to know about?
RESPONSE TEXT: Nothing beyond that. I've been trying to get the formulas working better for more varied environments, but for now, the current brew should serve.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Take any advantage I can get.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Stink bombs. Lovely.
RESPONSE TEXT: Just give them a try, first, Overboss. I think you'll enjoy the results.
DIALOGUE AFTER: LizzieWyath: Here. Only had enough to make the one locally, but you can take the recipe as well, should you find yourself wanting more.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Sounds like it's not worth the materials its made of.
RESPONSE TEXT: Try before you judge, Overboss. I've had some... pleasing results in the past.
DIALOGUE AFTER: LizzieWyath: Here. Only had enough to make the one locally, but you can take the recipe as well, should you find yourself wanting more.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Take any advantage I can get.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Wonderful.
RESPONSE TEXT: So, first up, something to manipulate a target. It's a homemade distillation brewed to mimic human flight pheromones.
Toss one these grenades at the feet of your target and convincing the wary settler suddenly becomes a much simpler affair.
Now, to function effectively, I had to make the formula... precise...
SCRIPT NOTES: Adding a caveat you're not proud of. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: ... so it's not going to work on people in any of the big towns like Bunker Hill or Diamond City nor on caravaners.
But for your purposes, hitting settlements out in the Commonwealth, it ought to give you a serious edge.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Take any advantage I can get.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll think about it.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's all I ask.
DIALOGUE AFTER: LizzieWyath: So, first up, something to manipulate a target. It's a homemade distillation brewed to mimic human flight pheromones.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Just give me what I want, all right? You don't get to make demands.
RESPONSE TEXT: Would never dream of it, Overboss. I'm only hoping you remember which gang's help you're receiving.
DIALOGUE AFTER: LizzieWyath: So, first up, something to manipulate a target. It's a homemade distillation brewed to mimic human flight pheromones.
SCRIPT NOTES: You're being overly polite. This person just threatened you and you're picturing murdering them in your head. / Amused

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Don't worry. Your gang will be taken care of.
RESPONSE TEXT: Wonderful.
DIALOGUE AFTER: LizzieWyath: So, first up, something to manipulate a target. It's a homemade distillation brewed to mimic human flight pheromones.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: LizzieWyath: Well, you've come to the right place.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Don't worry. Your gang will be taken care of.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04NPCFLizzieWyath: Overboss. A pleasure.
RESPONSE TEXT: Shank said you might need some tools to... ease relations with the people of the Commonwealth.
Well, you've come to the right place.
DIALOGUE AFTER: LizzieWyath: I've put together a couple of toys that should make getting what you want out of those rubes easier.

RESPONSE TEXT: No, no, no...
SCRIPT NOTES: You've been killed. More pleading as you go. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Ah! Ah. Ah.
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Rgh! Christ!
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Ergh!
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Didn't think this through, did you?
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening someone in the heat of combat. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: This was a bad, bad idea.
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening someone in the heat of combat. The bad idea here is your opponent attacking you, one of the most dangerous women alive. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Make a cadaver out of you.
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening someone in the heat of combat. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Well, aren't you brave?
Let's see what you're really made of.
Now don't make it too easy.
Overboss. A pleasure.
DIALOGUE AFTER: LizzieWyath: Shank said you might need some tools to... ease relations with the people of the Commonwealth.

RESPONSE TEXT: You looking for the boss? That'd be Mags.
Wasn't sure we could count on you. Good to know I was wrong.
Like how things are going, boss. We could get used to this kind of treatment.
Really making a place for yourself among Operators, aren't you?
You familiar with thallium, boss? Odorless, tasteless, colorless... and a very painful way to go.
SCRIPT NOTES: This is a threat. Implying you're ready to use this poison on the person you're talking to. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: If you're not going to support us, fine. Just don't hand this place over to the Pack. Turn it into one big litter box.
Oh. Our least favorite Overboss. Come back when you've claimed us some territory.
Colter's pushing up daisies. It's a lovely gift, but I think there are others our gang would like more. New territory, maybe?
SCRIPT NOTES: You're implying the player should be giving your gang more territory. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: There are some sick minds running around Nuka-World. All the more important you back us.
Underling to Overboss, Mags and William don't take well to being let down. So, make sure you get them something nice.
SCRIPT NOTES: A bit of a smirk. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: And here I thought this place was gaudy with the lights off. Still, not too shabby, boss.
Brought this place back to its former... is "glory" the word?
SCRIPT NOTES: A bit of a joke. You think this place you and your friends are living in is hideous. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Our Overboss returns triumphant.
SCRIPT NOTES: A bit of a joke. You think this place you and your friends are living in is hideous. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Would kill for an actual lab... though it hasn't helped yet.
Always thought the Parlor was a bit garish... but Mags and William have taken a shine to it and two trump one, I guess.
Walking around this place at night... even without the bodies it's hard to believe they ever let children in here.
Hmm. I wonder how much of Gage's little plan to replace Colter wasn't just to make sure the bosses didn't take off his head too?
So much money spent on this place. Just to hock some soda. Sad, don't you think?
So, this will be test eight of the persuasion formula. Our subject here... what'd you say your name was again?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Fuck you, Lizzie. When my crew finds out about this, they're going to wear your skin.
SCRIPT NOTES: Talking into a tape recorder while you're working on an experiment. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Fuck you, Lizzie. When my crew finds out about this, they're going to wear your skin.
RESPONSE TEXT: Okay, we're just going to call you Eight. Eight, would you please stop talking?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Go to hell.
SCRIPT NOTES: Addressing a person you're about to experiment on. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Go to hell.
RESPONSE TEXT: As you can see, Eight is currently not receptive to my suggestions. Now, deploying the formula.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Uh, what, what the... hey.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Uh, what, what the... hey.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hey yourself. Eight, how do you feel right now?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Fine. Good, I guess.
SCRIPT NOTES: Addressing a person you're experimenting on. You're trying to be sweet, soothing. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Fine. Good, I guess.
RESPONSE TEXT: Excellent. Now, Eight, I'm going to untie your arm.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Okay.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Okay.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Ergh!
RESPONSE TEXT: That's perfect. Thank you, Eight. You can stop now.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Thank you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Thank you.
RESPONSE TEXT: You're welcome. Eight, I'm going to untie you. Now, if you wouldn't mind-- Eight! What're you--
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Are you an idiot? Did you really think that shit would work? I'm going to eat your-- ugh!
SCRIPT NOTES: Addressing a person you're experimenting on. You're trying to be sweet initially, but you're interrupted as the person starts choking you. / Neutral

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Are you an idiot? Did you really think that shit would work? I'm going to eat your-- ugh!
RESPONSE TEXT: Thank you, William. I-I'm going to need a minute, before you bring in number nine.

RESPONSE TEXT: Yes?
